intro: Matelea schunkei, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed-like species. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its leaves are opposite and often have a velvety texture, while the stems are typically hairy. Matelea schunkei is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and nocturnal blooming habit.
